text: Aechmea aculeatosepala is a species of plant in the family Bromeliaceae. It is endemic to Ecuador.Kew World Checklist of Selected Plant FamiliesGovaerts, R. (2004). World Checklist of Monocotyledons Database in ACCESS: 1-54382. The Board of Trustees of the Royal Botanic Gardens, Kew. Its natural habitats are subtropical or tropical moist lowland forests and subtropical or tropical moist montane forests.Ulloa Ulloa, C. & D. A. Neill. 2005. Cinco Años de Adiciones a la Flora del Ecuador 1–75. Editorial UTPL, Loja. It is threatened by habitat loss. ==References== Category:Flora of Ecuador aculeatosepala Category:Vulnerable plants Category:Plants described in 1978 Category:Taxonomy articles created by Polbot
title: Aechmea aculeatosepala
